required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: HPV Message Testing and Social Media Campaign
clinical_study.official_title: HPV Message Testing and Social Media Campaign

brief_summary.textblock: This project involves a social media campaign to increase parent's knowledge and acceptance of the HPV (human papillomavirus) vaccine. The current vaccine protects against nine types of HPV, including seven that are known to cause cancer. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) estimates that the current HPV vaccine could prevent 90% of cancer cases caused by HPV, including cases of cervical cancer, oropharyngeal (mouth and throat) cancer, anal cancer, and others. About 150 and 104 cases of HPV-associated cancers are diagnosed each year in New Hampshire and Vermont, respectivelyâ€”many of which could be prevented through vaccination. Currently, only 49.8% of New Hampshire adolescents and 44.3% of Vermont adolescents were not up-to-date for HPV vaccination as of 2016. This social media campaign is testing a set of campaign messages with parents locally and nationally to see which messages are most effective in improving their knowledge and acceptance of the vaccine. A study survey link will monitor the number of people reached and will measure parental intention to get their children vaccinated against HPV.

study_design_info.masking_description: Participants are not aware of which arm of social messaging they are receiving and whether they are receiving the control message or not

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in intention to vaccinate their child with HPV vaccine
primary_outcome.time_frame: pre test immediately before viewing message and post test immediately after viewing message. Approximately one hour.
primary_outcome.description: Pre and Post surveys of participants viewing a specific social message

arm_group.description: Subjects are randomized to receive one of five messages on one of the four themes about HPV vaccination.
Subjects are randomized to receive one of five messages about electronic cigarettes.

intervention.intervention_name: Social Media Message about HPV and HPV vaccine
intervention.description: Messages educate parents with facts about HPV vaccination.

intervention.intervention_name: Social media message about risk of electronic cigarettes.
intervention.description: Messages educate parents with facts about electronic cigarettes. This is an attention control group without outcomes obtained.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- parents of children 9-14 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-parents
